intro: Phyllodoce breweri, commonly known as the Brewer's mountain-mint, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its small, tubular flowers are usually white or pale blue and bloom in late spring to early summer. Phyllodoce breweri plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in montane and subalpine habitats.
